title: Chebyshev's Inequality: University Applicants
question_text: State University applicants are required to take an admission test for entrance into the university. In a given year, $850\text{ applicants}$ took the test. The test results gave a mean score of $68\text{ points}$ with a standard deviation of $4\text{ points}$ . Suppose we do not know whether the scores are approximately normally distributed. What can be said about the number of scores that are less than $60\text{ points}$ ?

choices.text: No more than 2 2 of the scores are less than 60 60 .
At least 20 20 of the scores are less than 60 60 .
Of the scores, 0.0228 0.0228 are less than 60 60 .
At least 637 637 of the scores are less than 60 60 .
Most likely, no more than about 213 213 subjects can be expected to score either less than 60 60 or more than 76 76 .
